purpose: To highlight the complexity and visibility issues within the semiconductor supply chain.
title: The semiconductor supply chain is complex, and automotive companies have poor visibility into demand-supply dynamics
reasoning_strategy: Highlight key structural challenges and stages in the supply chain.

tables.title: Structural challenges for supply-demand balance
tables.description: Outlines key issues in the supply chain.

cells: Auto makes up just 10% of semiconductor demand and less than 5% of the foundry business
Six end markets, with semiconductor companies far removed from end-user demand
There are over 30 product types, with different design and manufacturing chains
Complex, distributed global supply chain; bottlenecks can occur anywhere
Fragmentation of manufacturing capacity across integrated device manufacturers and foundries
